com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler

Class WorkSetTracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.WorkSetTracker

  • public class WorkSetTracker
extends java.lang.Object
    Tracks the current work set in the service, and determines whether the service has new work that warrants a revive.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WorkSetTracker(java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> namespace)
      Creates an instance which will use the configured singleton TokenBucket for rate limiting.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WorkSetTracker

        public WorkSetTracker(java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> namespace)
        Creates an instance which will use the configured singleton TokenBucket for rate limiting. The TokenBucket is a shared singleton because we want revive rate limits to be enforced across all running services in the scheduler process.

    • Method Detail

      • updateWorkSet

        public void updateWorkSet(java.util.Collection<Step> activeWorkSet)
        Instead of just suppressing offers when all work is complete, we set refuse seconds of 1 hour (a.k.a. forever) whenever we decline any offer. When we see *new* work (PodInstanceRequirements) we assume that the offers we've declined forever may be useful to that work, and so we revive offers.

        Pseudo-code algorithm:

        // We always start out revived List oldWorkSet = getWorkSet();

        while (true) { List currWorkSet = getWorkSet() List newWorkSet = oldWorkSet - currWorkSet; if (newWorkSet.isEmpty()) { print "No new work"; } else { oldWorkSet = currWorkSet; newWork = true; } }

        The invariant maintained is that oldWorkSet always had revive called for it at least once, giving it access to offers.

        This case must work:

        • kafka-0-broker fails @ 10:30, it's new work!
        • kafka-0-broker recovers @ 10:35
        • kafka-0-broker fails @ 11:00, it's new work!
        • ...

      • hasNewWork

        public boolean hasNewWork()
        Returns whether new work has appeared via a prior call to updateWorkSet(Collection). This information should be passed upstream so that they know to revive offers. The state is internally reset after this call has occurred.
